*28 - Very Rev Paton James Gloag, Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland in 1889

Born in Perth on 7 February 1828, he was son of William Gloag, a banker in Perth, by his wife Jessie, daughter of John Burn, writer to the Signet of Edinburgh. Paton James Gloag the theologian writer and Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland in 1889, was his eldest brother, and his eldest sister was Jessie Burn Gloag, who founded a ragged school in Perth.

In 1863 he spoke against the admission of women into Scottish universities.Church of Scotland: Report of Proceedings of Seventh Annual Congress, 1863 He retired in 1870The History of Galashiels: Robert Hall and thereafter committed himself fully to Mission work in the Scottish cities. His postion in Galashiels was filled by Rev Paton James Gloag. From 1863 to 1888 Phin was Convenor of the Army and Navy Chaplains Committee. Edinburgh University awarded him an honorary Doctor of Divinity in 1869.
